data.question: What is the main feature of the triphosphaazatriangulene (H3L) synthesized in the study?
data.answer: The main feature of H3L is its stimuli-responsive reversible transformation from a 3D-MOF to a 1D-columnar assembled proton-conducting material.

data.question: What is the proton conductivity of the 1D-columnar assembled material at 95% relative humidity and 60°C?
What role do the phosphonate monoester groups play in the MOFs mentioned in the study?
data.answer: Phosphonate monoester groups offer carboxylate-like coordination modes to form MOFs that are chemically and thermally stable.

data.question: How was the MOF [Cu(HL)(DMSO)·(MeOH)]n synthesized?
data.answer: By mixing a solution of H3L in DMSO with CuSO4·5 H2O in MeOH at 40°C for 2 days.

data.question: What triggers the transformation between the 3D-MOF and the 1D-columnar assembled material?
data.answer: Changes in solvent vapor trigger the transformation.

data.question: Is the transformation from the 3D-MOF to the 1D-columnar assembled material reversible?
Does the 1D-columnar assembled material exhibit higher proton conductivity at higher relative humidity?
data.answer: Yes, the proton conductivity increases with increasing relative humidity.

data.question: What is the activation energy for proton conduction in the 1D-columnar assembled material?
Can the 3D-MOF absorb methanol vapor while maintaining its overall crystalline structure?
data.answer: Yes, the 3D-MOF can absorb methanol vapor while maintaining its crystalline structure.

data.question: What is the yield of the MOF [Cu(HL)(DMSO)·(MeOH)]n when synthesized?
What happens to the MOF when exposed to water vapor?
data.answer: It transforms into a 1D-columnar assembled material.

data.question: Is the transformation from MOF to 1D-columnar assembled material a single-crystal-to-single-crystal process?
What is the role of H3L in the formation of proton-conducting pathways?
data.answer: H3L creates proton-conducting pathways with its hydrophilic domain stabilized by peripheral hydrophilic phosphinate groups.

data.question: Does the study provide a new approach to designing smart materials?
data.answer: Yes, the study contributes to the design and synthesis of new smart materials.

data.question: What is the role of DMSO in the structure of MOF 1?
data.answer: DMSO molecules coordinate to Cu2+ and can interact with guest molecules.

data.question: Are the transformations between the 3D-MOF and 1D-columnar assembled material due to the amphiphilic nature of H3L?
What is the initial step in the synthesis of triangulene H3L?
Does the 1D-columnar assembled material exhibit proton conductivity at 25°C and 55% RH?
data.answer: Yes, it exhibits proton conductivity of 5.9 X 10@8 S cm@1.

data.question: What is the significance of the hydrophilic and hydrophobic domains in the transformation process?
data.answer: The hydrophilic and hydrophobic domains facilitate the reversible transformation between the 3D-MOF and 1D-columnar assembled material.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of the 1D-columnar assembled material dependent on temperature?
data.answer: True, the conductivity increases with temperature up to 60°C at 95% RH.
